data.title: Goopy Bagha Feere Elo (1992)
data.meta_description: Goopy Bagha Phire Elo (Bengali: গুপী বাঘা ফিরে এলো) (1992) is the third sequel of Goopy Gyne Bagha Byne series. It was directed by Sandip Ray and written by his father Satyajit Ray. This film was released eleven years after its predecessor Hirak Rajar Deshe.
data.text:
Sandip Ray’s comedy sequel. Bagha and Roopy are invited at a palace of a king and their number of attitudes as they are trapped by an astrologer cum imposter. In Bengali with English subtitles.

The last film in the Goopy trilogy concentrates on Goopy (Tapen Chatterjee) and Bagha (Rabi Ghosh), the rulers of Shundi, who depart their lavish life behind for a new escapade. They, ultimately, encounter Brahmananda Acharya (Ajit Bandyopadhyay) who oaths to make them young if they obtain three valuable stones.

Tapen Chatterjee and Rabi Ghosh both give very good performances reprising their respective roles as the two title characters, ulers of Shundi who are going to get more than they bargained for while on their new adventure,…

Undoubtedly and expectedly the weakest of the trilogy - it's not directed by Satyajit Ray, so that's no wonder. Nonetheless, as it's written by him, his son's okay-ish directing - which is mostly all modeled after his father's "hirak rajar deshe" directing template. The palaces look the same as the previous film, it opens and closes the same way. Sandip Ray doesn't bring a lot of his own here and I think that's why the film becomes mostly entertaining and enjoyable to watch.

I liked how dark the film was - Brahmananda Acharya is easily the most dark and powerful villian of the trilogy - him keeping 12 year old boys hostage and then making Goopy Baagha steal gems for…
